required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Canadian Study of the MicroVention Flow Re-Direction (FRED) Endoluminal Device Stent System in the Treatment of Intracranial Aneurysms
clinical_study.official_title: Canadian Study of the MicroVention Flow Re-Direction (FRED) Endoluminal Device Stent System in the Treatment of Intracranial Aneurysms - The CanFRED Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

clinical_study.source: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

brief_summary.textblock: The study objective is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the MicroVention FRED System when used in the treatment of wide-necked intracranial aneurysms.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study not initiated at our site.

primary_outcome.description: A major stroke is defined as a new neurological event that persists for > 24 hours and results in a mRS >2. A minor stroke is defined as a new neurological event that persists for > 24 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: neurological death or major ipsilateral stroke, measured by mRS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of FRED System and procedure related Serious Adverse Events;
Incidence of successful delivery of the FRED System implant;
Incidence of migration of the FRED System implant
Unplanned alternative treatment on the target IA (Defined as re-treatment of the target aneurysm due to worsening of the clinical condition of the subject)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as re-treatment of the target aneurysm due to worsening of the clinical condition of the subject

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in clinical and functional outcomes (as measured by an increase in the modified Rankin Scale compared to baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: as measured by an increase in the modified Rankin Scale compared to baseline

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)
